thread.title: CPM will demolish century-old building near U of M, plans hotel
thread.title_full: CPM will demolish century-old building near U of M, plans hotel

author: Mark Reilly
title: CPM will demolish century-old building near U of M, plans hotel
text:
Nancy Kuehn | MSPB Daniel Oberpriller (left) and Nick Walton of CPM stand at the WaHu project on Washingtonâ€¦ more Developer CPM Cos. is continuing its flurry of building around the University of Minnesota campus with the purchase of a Huron Boulevard site, where it plans to build a five-story hotel. Finance & Commerce reports that CPM paid $4.32 million for two parcels at Huron Boulevard and Essex Street in Minneapolis. The properties include the former Everfresh Foods Corp. building, a 104-year-old structure that CPM will raze for the new project, a 140-room Doubletree by Hilton. The Business Journal reported on CPM's hopes for the site back in March, but the company didn't have a hotel partner then. The developer is shelving an earlier plan to build a 123-room hotel across the street. 
Want Minneapolis / St. Paul Travel   Home of the Day
